messages:
Name: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain
Nationality: England
Date of Birth: August 15, 1993
Position: Midfielder
Current club: Liverpool
Premier League clubs played for: Arsenal, Liverpool
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain is a Liverpool midfielder who was not involved in the club's first Premier League game in 2023/2024.
Oxlade-Chamberlain last made an appearance in a Premier League game on April 1, 2023, playing 20 minutes for Liverpool against Manchester City in a 4-1 defeat.
Up next for Liverpool - who are in 11th position on one point - in Premier League action is a home match against Bournemouth on August 19.
Last season for Liverpool, Oxlade-Chamberlain made nine Premier League appearances and scored one goal.
Prior to moving to Liverpool in August 2017, Oxlade-Chamberlain made 132 league appearances in total at Arsenal, scoring nine goals and providing 14 assists.

Oxlade-Chamberlain began his Premier League career for Arsenal on August 28, 2011, playing 28 minutes as a substitute versus Manchester United aged 18 years and 13 days. He debuted at Premier League level for current club Liverpool in his side's match with Manchester City on September 9, 2017.

In his Premier League career overall, he has played 235 matches in the competition, with 20 goals and 24 assists. Oxlade-Chamberlain, who has been shown 10 yellow cards overall, is yet to be sent off in the competition, despite playing 235 games to date.
